title: Former NBA champion rips soccer league for offering non-binary, gender-fluid options on children's signups
description: While signing up his 6-year-old son for a soccer league in Australia, Andrew Bogut took exception to the organization's multiple gender options.

title: Giants will franchise Saquon Barkley if Daniel Jones deal gets done: report
description: The franchise tag deadline is March 7, and the Giants are working to iron out a long-term deal with Daniel Jones. If that happens, a report says, Saquon Barkley will get tagged.

title: California winery shut down for using illegal liquor license for 3 years
description: A California winery was shut down after operating for three years without a liquor license. Ernest Hemingway Vineyards had an expired liquor license from the previous owner.

title: Massachusetts Democrat resigns following backlash for comments about abortion and special needs children
description: Michael Hugo announced his resignation as the chair of the Framingham Democratic Committee in Massachusetts after controversy over his comments on abortion.

title: Pennsylvania man carrying explosives in airport luggage held without bail
description: Marc Muffley of Lansford, Pennsylvania is being held without bail after admitting to packing explosives in his luggage for an Orlando-bound Allegiant flight.

title: Whale safety research planned near East Coast's offshore wind farms
description: Researchers are planning to monitor whale safety near offshore wind farms on the East Coast, joining similar initiatives aimed at determining the effect of the projects on whale deaths.

title: Yosemite National Park closed indefinitely amid extreme weather onslaught
description: Yosemite National Park will be closed indefinitely as the park gets hit by unusually snowy weather, with some areas of the park accumulating 15 feet of snow, according to the National Park Service.

title: California police, FBI comb through 'substantial amount of evidence' after explosives found at suspect's home
description: A California man has been arrested amid a police probe into suspected explosives and drug offenses, authorities said.

title: Two Americans arrested for reportedly sending aviation technology to Russia: official
description: Two Americans were arrested in Kansas City for allegedly sending U.S. aviation technology to Russia as the war in Ukraine rages on, according to the U.S. Commerce Department.

title: Tom Cruise filming 'Mission: Impossible 8' scenes on US aircraft carrier
description: Tom Cruise began shooting scenes from the upcoming eighth and rumored last installment of the "Mission: Impossible" series on an aircraft carrier off Italy last weekend.

title: Gunmen threaten Lionel Messi after opening fire on family supermarket: 'We’re waiting for you'
description: Police in Argentina said Thursday that two gunman left a threatening message for international soccer star Lionel Messi after opening fire on his in-laws' grocery store.

title: Discover Financial to reportedly track gun store purchases starting in April
description: Discover Financial Services reportedly proclaimed it will move forward in April to track purchases in gun stores, aiming to prevent firearms related crime.

title: TikTok's only defenders in Washington are those 'paid to do so': FCC commissioner
description: Federal Communications Commission commissioner Brendan Carr says policy against TikTok is a 'step in the right direction,' but it will eventually be banned.

title: LeBron James suffered tendon injury in foot, will be reevaluated in three weeks as Lakers make playoff push
description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James suffered a tendon injury in his right foot against the Dallas Mavericks, and he will be reevaluated in three weeks.

title: Israeli forces fatally shoot teenager amid West Bank violence
description: Israeli forces in the West Bank fatally shot a teenager in the back as he threw stones at Israeli troops who entered the village. This attack was a part of the violence raging for months.

title: Owner of rehab center chain arrested for health care fraud
description: Recovery Connection Centers of America owner Michael Brier of Newton, Massachusetts, was arrested for allegedly neglecting patient needs and cheating health insurers out of millions.

title: Students, staff emotional as Michigan State removes memorial flowers
description: Michigan State University students and staff have begun an emotional process of removing memorial flowers left at campus landmarks for the three victims of a February shooting.

title: Michigan's Jim Harbaugh says NFL interest a 'positive thing'
description: Michigan football head coach Jim Harbaugh said during a press conference last week that NFL interest in his staff and players is a "positive thing."

title: Dogs that mauled Texas veteran to death were trained with meat to be aggressive: report
description: The dogs that mauled an elderly Air Force veteran to death in San Antonio were allegedly raised to be aggressive by their owners, a husband and wife duo who have been arrested

title: Goalie Jonathan Quick acquired by Golden Knights in second trade in two days
description: For the second time this week, Jonathan Quick is on the move. Columbus sent the goaltender to the Golden Knights in exchange for a player and a 2025 seventh-round pick.

title: OJ Simpson remarks on Alex Murdaugh trial: 'I don’t know why they think I’m an expert on it'
description: O.J. Simpson offered his own take on the Alex Murdaugh trial and drew parallels to his own conviction in his Las Vegas incident from several years ago.

title: White House says Biden’s laugh while discussing fentanyl crisis taken out of context: ‘his heart goes out’
description: The White House said President Biden's laugh while discussing the fentanyl crisis Wednesday night was taken out of context as the president himself has experienced personal loss.

title: Former Nevada bank teller sentenced for exploitation of elderly handicapped woman
description: A former Nevada bank teller has been sentenced for exploitation of an elderly handicapped woman she befriended. The woman was ordered to pay $25K in restitution.

title: New Orleans police nab suspect in killing of Uber driver and passenger: police
description: New Orleans, Louisiana police arrested a man on Wednesday for allegedly shooting and killing an Uber driver and passenger near Interstate 10 on Feb. 20, 2023.

title: Phoenix condo fire kills 3; 2 children remain hospitalized
description: A Phoenix condo fire killed three people on Wednesday night. Four children were pulled out of the blaze; two of them died, and the other two remain hospitalized in critical condition.

title: Cindy McCain to head UN's World Food Program
description: U.S. Ambassador Cindy McCain, widow of former Republican Arizona Senator John McCain, has been appointed head of the United Nations' World Food Program.

title: Patrick Kane talks leaving Blackhawks for Rangers: 'This is such an amazing opportunity'
description: Patrick Kane will take the ice with a team other than the Chicago Blackhawks for the first time in 16 years. The New York Rangers wanted him, and he couldn't pass it up.

title: California Sen. Dianne Feinstein hospitalized in San Francisco
description: California Democratic Sen. Dianne Feinstein is receiving treatment for shingles in a San Francisco hospital, her office said Thursday, adding that she expects to make a "full recovery."

title: Far-left Olbermann ridiculed for reviving 'move Disney World' idea to spite DeSantis
description: Leftist Twitter personality Keith Olbermann revived a previously ridiculed argument on Twitter to relocate Disney World to spite Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis.

title: Biden says he'll visit East Palestine - but won't say when
description: President Joe Biden finally stated that he will visit the East Palestine, Ohio, town where a freight train derailment caused hazardous chemicals to be released into the open air.

title: More than half the world's population will be obese or overweight by 2035, says new report
description: More than half the world's population will be overweight or obese by 2035, says the World Obesity Federation in a new report. Obesity rates are said to be rising particularly fast among children.

title: Muslim group warns LGBTQ rights bill could encroach on religious liberty: 'Cramming this legislation through'
description: A Muslim advocacy group has launched a petition urging Michigan lawmakers to provide religious protections in a proposed LGBTQ rights bill.

title: Flights into, out of Texas canceled with storms approaching
description: Hundreds of flights into and out of Texas have been canceled due to severe storms approaching. There have been 400 total cancelations as the storm moves eastward.

title: Missouri bill to ease access for breast cancer screenings
description: A Missouri bill has been approved Thurday in an attempt to ease access to breast cancer screenings. This bill will aid in identifying cancer and other serious diseases early.

title: Kim Kardashian sizzles in tiny bikini in new shower photos as fans go wild
description: Kim Kardashian set the internet on fire with a series of new bikini photos posted to her Instagram. The mother of four posed seductively in an outdoor shower.

title: Christina Aguilera reveals she uses injectables for ‘more natural look,’ talks aging in the spotlight
description: Grammy Award-winning pop singer Christina Aguilera. 42, candidly admitted she uses injectables to feel her "best" and keep herself looking youthful in the spotlight.

title: Guinea, Ivory Coast repatriating citizens from Tunisia after migrant crackdown
description: The nations of Guinea and Ivory Coast are repatriating citizens from Tunisia who want to leave after a migrant crackdown. Tunisian president called for urgent measures on illegal immigration.

title: Ted Cruz rips Buttigieg at CPAC: 'What the hell does this guy gotta do to get fired?'
description: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, on Thursday asked how Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg could still be holding onto his job after the chemical spill in Ohio, the private jet scandal and other headaches.

title: Skier, snowboarder make harrowing escape from Mt. Washington avalanche
description: Hiker RJ Phipps recorded a video showing a skier and snowboarder maneuvering around an avalanche 4,800 feet up New Hampshire's Mount Washington.

title: Biden snubbed by House Democrats as they skipped speech for DC concert
description: More than a dozen Democrats snubbed President Biden Wednesday night while he was giving a speech at a Maryland retreat and instead attended a Joni Mitchell concert.

title: Jalen Carter returns to NFL Combine hours after arrest stemming from link in fatal crash
description: Hours after his arrest in Georgia stemming from a deadly crash, top NFL prospect Jalen Carter returned to the NFL Scouting Combine in Indianapolis.

title: AOC faces House ethics probe over Met Gala, watchdog finds 'substantial reason to believe' violations occurred
description: The House Office of Congressional Ethics found “substantial reason to believe” that AOC violated House ethics rules when she accepted gifts in the form of tickets for the 2021 Met Gala.

title: California man argues with San Jose hot dog vendor, allegedly leads to ambush, assault and arrest
description: Dioscoro Reyes allegedly hit hot dog vendor Saul Reconco in the head outside the SAP Center in San Jose, California over an argument about how long his food was taking, police say.

title: Meghan Markle, Prince Harry's Frogmore Cottage eviction: Prince Andrew ‘insulted’ by new move, experts say
description: A spokesperson for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle confirmed the couple has been asked to vacate Frogmore Cottage. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex reportedly have until early summer.

title: Eagles’ A.J. Brown's beef with Chiefs' JuJu Smith-Schuster ramps up: 'Find you somebody else to play with'
description: A.J. Brown fired off tweets — later deleting them — at JuJu Smith-Schuster in response to a skit about the Eagles' Super Bowl loss and Brown's "TikTok boy" insult.

title: California woman's body found along Ohio River in West Virginia
description: A California missing woman's body was found along the Ohio River in West Virginia on Feb. 22. The woman has been reported missing since December of this year.

title: Saints' Alvin Kamara pleads not guilty to battery charges from Vegas nightclub brawl
description: New Orleans Saints star running back Alvin Kamara appeared in a Las Vegas court on Thursday where he pled not guilty to battery charges stemming from a nightclub brawl last year.

title: Michigan morgue employee broke into dead people's homes: police
description: A Michigan morgue employee was caught trying to burglarize the home of a deceased person in suburban Detroit, police said.

title: Georgia Senate passes bill to discipline prosecutors engaging in misconduct
description: The Georgia State Senate has agreed to pass a bill that will create a commission to discipline prosecutors who engage in misconduct. The bill has been sent to the House for further debate.

title: Scientists discover new Easter Island moai statue in dry lake bed
description: Scientists have found a previously undiscovered moai, monolithic human figures carved by the Rapa Nui people on Easter Island, in a dry lake bed.

title: New Hampshire man killed 83-year-old with hatchet, prosecutors say
description: Robert Gagnon of Manchester, New Hampshire, is accused of killing Robert Prest, 83, with a hatchet and attempting to kill Carlos Quintong, 44, in a separate incident.

title: Actor Tim Robbins backs Woody Harrelson on ending COVID-19 protocols: ‘Time to end this charade’
description: "Shawshank Redemption" actor Tim Robbins blasted continuing COVID-19 safety protocols on Twitter recently, claiming it's "Time to end this charade."

title: Yankees' Wandy Peralta takes advantage of MLB pitch clock, strikes out batter in 20 seconds
description: Wandy Peralta apparently is a huge fan of the pitch clock, so much so that he used it to his advantage for a tremendously fast strikeout on Thursday.

title: Texas sheriff's office to investigate why man given long prison term was released from jail by mistake
description: A Texas man sentenced to 25 years for aggravated assault of a family member was erroneously released from jail on Wednesday as he awaited his transfer to prison.

title: Patriots legend Willie McGinest hit with 2 felonies stemming from fight at Hollywood restaurant
description: Former New England Patriots star Willie McGinest has been charged with two felonies stemming from his role in a fight at a West Hollywood restaurant in December.

title: Bruins, David Pastrnak agree to massive eight-year contract extension
description: The Boston Bruins announced Thursday they have signed star forward David Pastrnak. 26, to an 8-year, $90 million contract. It's the sixth-richest deal in NHL history.

title: Drive-thru diet: Nashville grandpa plans to eat McDonald’s for 100 days in weight-loss attempt
description: A man from Nashville, Tennessee, is eating nothing but McDonald’s fast food for 100 days in an unconventional attempt to lose weight. He's particularly watching portion control.

title: Taylor Lewan says ‘everyone’s overreacting’ to garbage bag drop-off, told Titans to bring his stuff
description: The Tennessee Titans released Taylor Lewan and dropped his stuff off in garbage bags – but the offensive lineman says the relationship is just fine.

title: PNC Bank ends business relationship with Donald Trump Jr's MxM News app company 'without cause'
description: PNC abruptly terminated its business relationship with the news aggregation app company launched last year by Donald Trump Jr. and former Trump spokesman Taylor Budowich.

title: Critical race theory has taken over academic life at this Florida university
description: There has been a stunning transformation at Florida International University. The DEI bureaucrats have managed to infuse CRT into almost every aspect of academic life.

title: Mike Lee calls out AG Garland for 'preposterous' answers on lack of arrests for attacks on pro-life centers
description: Sen. Mike Lee called out Attorney Merrick Garland during a Senate Judiciary Committee hearing over the lack of arrests for pro-life attacks.

title: Nikki Haley will face uphill battle due to history with Donald Trump, Rove predicts
description: Fox News contributor Karl Rove weighs in on the battle Nikki Haley could face in the 2024 campaign season during Fox Nation's new special, 'Who is Nikki Haley?'

title: Michigan children, both under 5, killed in house fire
description: Two children, ages 3 and 4, were reportedly killed in a Thursday morning house fire in Benton Harbor, Michigan. Three adults and four other children escaped the home alive.

title: Agency investigating Kansas GOP broke open meetings law, complaint alleges
description: Two defense attorneys for Kansas Republicans accused of ethics violations have accused the state's ethics commission of violating its open meetings law.

title: Chris Pratt’s 'Super Mario Bros. Movie' co-director defends him amid fan backlash
description: The co-director of "The Super Mario Bros. Movie" defended the decision to cast Chris Pratt, saying in a recent interview the actor was "perfect for it."

title: Ex-Tennessee cop Maegan Hall breaks silence on sex scandal that rocked police department
description: Former Tennessee police officer Meagan Hall spoke out for the first time since a sex scandal at the La Vergne Police Department broke, arguing she was pressured into the affairs.

title: Louisiana Gov. John Bel Edwards names new DOTD chief
description: Louisiana's Gov. John Bel Edwards has named a new Department of Transportation secretary to replace Shawn Wilson. Edwards appointed Eric Kalivoda to take over the position.

title: Florida prosecutor faces scrutiny after fatal shooting of TV reporter, 9 year old, woman
description: FL Gov. Ron DeSantis is eyeing a prosecutor due to the way she handled a case involving fatal shootings. The suspect was charged with killing a reporter, a 9 year old girl, and a woman.

title: California convicted murderer arrested for woman's 1980 slaying
description: A convicted murderer who was already serving life sentences has been arrested for another murder. The man was suspected of killing a woman who was found dead in a California in 1980.

title: Residents evacuated, neighboring buildings consumed by Hong Kong skyscraper fire
description: Neighboring buildings were evacuated as a fire razed a skyscraper under construction in Hong Kong's densely populated Tsim Sha Tsui shopping district.

title: 'Freedom matters': Dallas exhibit at George W. Bush Presidential Center has opened
description: The George W. Bush Presidential Center in Dallas, Texas, opened a new exhibit about American freedom — and includes such artifacts as the Magna Carta and the Declaration of Independence.

title: Italy closes investigation alleging COVID lockdown failures
description: Italy prosecutors closed an investigation alleging COVID lockdown failures in the early days of lockdown. The case will now go to a magistrate to decide whether to indict more suspects.

title: New Orleans woman uses Apple AirTag to find stolen wallet, confronts thief: Police
description: A New Orleans woman used an Apple AirTag to track her stolen wallet in February, and she confronted the suspect in a parking lot, police say.

title: Buffalo firefighter killed in downtown blaze identified
description: The firefighter killed Wednesday in a downtown Buffalo, New York, commercial building has been identified by authorities as 37-year-old Jason Arno.

title: California cold case cracked with DNA from ‘unprovable’ rape case: prosecutors
description: A man was arrested for a 1979 California murder, which prosecutors said was "one of the oldest cold case murders in the country to be solved through a sexual assault DNA."

title: Top Democrat calls Biden the 'most progressive president that we've had in a long time'
description: Rep. Pramila Jayapal said the Congressional Progressive Caucus has a "strong partnership" with the Biden administration and that Biden is the "most progressive president" in recent years.

title: Graphic drag show for babies featuring nearly naked men, bondage, outrages Twitter: 'Absolutely abhorrent'
description: A graphic video from a UK drag event for moms and babies shocked Twitter users this week with some users wondering why this kind of event was legal.

title: Will Smith says he was spit on by White actor while filming 'Emancipation'
description: Will Smith opened up about being spit on by a White actor while filming "Emancipation." Smith made the revelation while giving his first awards speech since the 2022 Oscars controversy.

title: St. Gabriel, Louisiana, police officer arrested for murder
description: A Louisiana police officer was arrested Thursday for murdering a 26-year-old man. The officer allegedly entered the victim's home without permission and fired several rounds at him.

title: Florida man arrested after 4 found shot dead inside home, including his 15-year-old daughter
description: Domenico Claude Gigante, 36, fatally shot four family members, including his own teen daughter, at a home in Cocoa, Florida, early Wednesday, investigators said.

title: With guns now allowed on college campuses, WV governor pledges 'mess with us, we can mess back'
description: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice signed a campus carry bill into law, allowing concealed carry permit holders to carry their firearms on college campuses in the state.

title: University of Wisconsin leader to seek 5% tuition hike from regents
description: Jay Rothman, president of the University of Wisconsin System, has proposed an across-the-board tuition increase of 5% to the academic institution's regents.

title: Biden won’t veto bill blocking the softening of DC's criminal code
description: President Biden informed Senate Democrats in a closed-door meeting Thursday that he won't veto legislation blocking the Washington, D.C., Council's move to soften crime laws.

title: St. Louis prosecutor Kim Gardner scorched online after execution-style shooting of homeless man
description: St. Louis Circuit Attorney Kim Gardner is facing growing pressure to resign after the execution-style shooting of homeless David Saldana allegedly by Deshawn Thomas in broad daylight.

title: Florida sheriff tears into Neo-Nazi agitators: 'These scumbags came to the wrong county'
description: Volusia County Sheriff Mike Chitwood tore into a group of Neo-Nazis agitators who have been making trouble in his community over the past few days.

title: House Ethics Committee launches investigation into George Santos
description: The House Committee on Ethics has unanimously voted to establish an investigative subcommittee to look into the allegations of unlawful activity in Rep. George Santos' 2022 campaign.

title: Jerry Seinfeld's wife shares rare photo of actor's lookalike son on his 20th birthday
description: Jerry Seinfeld and his wife celebrated their son Julian's 20th birthday by sharing a photo of the comedian's lookalike. Jerry and his wife Jessica share three kids.

title: Senate GOP plots confrontation of 'woke' Pentagon as military readiness, morale plummet
description: Republican senators are expected address the issue of "woke" policies within the U.S. military that they say are affecting the readiness and morale of service members.

title: New York firefighter and 9/11 first responder to hike Appalachian Trail to raise money, awareness for PTSD
description: Volunteer firefighter Rob Weisberg of New York will be hiking the Appalachian Trail to raise money for nonprofit Paws of War, plus awareness for first responders and veterans with PTSD.

title: Sarah Huckabee Sanders torches Karine Jean-Pierre, liberal media: China's 'defense attorneys' on COVID
description: Arkansas Gov. Sarah Huckabee Sanders ripped the White House and media over pandemic origins, accusing them of protecting China in the COVID investigation.

title: 2024 signal? Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis heading to Iowa next week
description: Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida next week will visit Iowa, the state that holds the first contest in the 2024 Republican presidential nominating calendar.

title: Pennsylvania man admitted to packing explosives in suitcase at Lehigh Valley airport, federal prosecutors say
description: Marc Muffley is making a federal court appearance in Allentown, Pennsylvania on Thursday following the incident at Lehigh Valley International Airport.

title: Massive Hong Kong fire consumes skyscraper under construction, raining burning embers rain onto street
description: A massive fire broke out after midnight at a skyscraper in Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, raining embers and smoke down into the urban area as firefighters fought the blaze.

title: Police say 3 foreign skiers were killed in Canadian avalanche
description: An avalanche in southeastern British Columbia killed three foreign skiers Wednesday near the Panorama Mountain Resort. Four others were inured but are expected to recover.

title: Rhode Island Democrats seek to decriminalize 'magic mushrooms'
description: Two Rhode Island Democratic lawmakers have introduced legislation that would decriminalize possession of a small amount of psilocybin, or "magic" mushrooms, for personal use.

title: Missouri governor would control St. Louis police under bill
description: The Missouri governor would control the St. Louis police under a bill that has advanced in the state House. Some Missourians are arguing that the city is failing to control crime.

title: Mystery 30-foot chamber found inside Egypt's Great Pyramid
description: Egyptian officials revealed the discovery of a mysterious, 30-foot-long corridor sealed off inside the Pyramid of Khufu on Thursday. It was discovered using modern scanning.

title: North Carolina Lt. Gov. Robinson to give GOP response to Democratic Gov. Cooper
description: North Carolina Lt. Gov. Mark Robinson will give the GOP response to Democratic Gov. Cooper's State of the State address next week. Cooper's address will be Monday night.

title: Biden DOJ says Trump can be sued by police, Democrats over Jan. 6 riot
description: Police and Democratic lawmakers can sue former President Trump over his role in the Jan. 6 storming of the U.S. Capitol, the Justice Department announced Thursday.

title: Jury begins deliberations in 2nd trial of AZ man accused of killing 2 Tucson girls
description: The second trial of an Arizona man who allegedly murdered two Tucson girls a couple years apart has gone to the jury. Cristopher Clements is facing first-degree murder of a 6-year-old.

title: Half of CA no longer in drought after tremendous amount of rain, snow hit the state last year
description: Last year’s rain and snowfall have freed half of California from drought. Three months ago, virtually the entire state was in drought including extreme levels.

title: Woman who got no answer from 911 with robber in home calls for town's secession from liberal-run Atlanta
description: Residents of the wealthy Buckhead suburb urge Georgia lawmakers to allow them vote on a proposal to break away from the crime-ridden city.

title: Jerry Richardson, founder and former owner of the Panthers, dead at 86
description: Jerry Richardson, the founder and former owner of the Carolina Panthers, died on Wednesday night, the team announced. He was 86.

title: Hershey's faces backlash over putting trans woman on candy bar wrapper for International Women’s Day
description: Twitter users slammed a new ad from Hershey's Canada featuring trans woman Fae Johnstone as the face of its "International Woman's Day" campaign.

title: 42 Spanish families pursuing legal action against nurse who allegedly faked the vaccine process for children
description: A nurse in Spain allegedly faked the process of administering vaccines to children. Forty-two Spanish families are pursuing legal actions against the nurse.

title: Denise Richards’ mini-me daughter Sami Sheen sizzles in cheeky bikini photoshoot
description: "Real Housewives of Beverly Hills" alum Denise Richards' 18-year-old daughter Sami Sheen shared a revealing swimsuit photo during her vacation in Hawaii.

title: Judge in Young Thug trial orders investigation into leaked evidence
description: The judge overseeing a gang case against Young Thug has ordered a probe into an evidence leak. A video was released and shows a Georgia witness offering information.

title: Ravens player rips GM over comments about wide receiving corps: 'Stop pointing the finger at us'
description: Baltimore Ravens wide receiver Rashod Bateman slammed general manager Eric DeCosata's statements about the wide receiving corps on Thursday.

title: Buenos Aires plunges into darkness after energy grid fire causes massive blackout
description: Massive regions of Argentina are experiencing blackouts after a grid was on fire. Residents are left without power as they endure a major heat wave in the country.

title: Premier League urged to review details of deal made between Saudi Arabia wealth fund, Newcastle United
description: Newcastle United promised the Premier League that the Saudi wealth fund that acquired the club is separate from the government. The league is being urged to review this detail.

title: Former Italy PM investigated for allegedly mishandling COVID outbreak
description: Italy’s former Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte is being placed under investigation. He is accused of mishandling the coronavirus pandemic that broke out in 2020.

title: MI5 failed in Ariana Grande concert bombing that killed 22 inquiry finds
description: The U.K.'s top intelligence agency MI5 failed to respond to key information that could have stopped the 2017 suicide bombing at an Ariana Grande concert in Manchester that killed 22 people.

title: Biden proposes sweeping $1.6B crackdown on pandemic aid fraudsters: 'You cannot hide'
description: President Biden rolled out a $1.6 billion proposal on Thursday to go after COVID-19 pandemic scammers, prevent identity theft and provide assistance to victims of Unemployment Insurance and PPP loan fraud.

title: US to propose restrictions on ‘forever chemicals’ in drinking water after previously underestimating its risks
description: The Environmental Protection Agency plans to propose restrictions on “forever chemicals” in drinking water. The agency previously underestimated how hazardous small amounts could be.

title: Federal judge sentences Massachusetts man to probation for running illegal hare trapping operation in Maine
description: A Massachusetts man was sentenced to probation for running an illegal hare trapping operation in Maine. The man was fined $10,000 and was ordered to pay $1,843 in restitution to Maine.

title: Kandinsky painting that spent decades in Dutch museum sells at auction for $44.9 million
description: A Kandinsky painting called "Murnau with Church II“ sold for $44.9 million in London. The painting has been at a Dutch museum for decades after the owner was killed in the Holocaust.

title: Fifth airport near-collision of year sparks concerns: This problem is 'on the rise'
description: Aviation expert and pilot Kyle Bailey dissects numerous factors contributing to a rise in airport close calls as the FAA investigates the fifth incident of 2023.

title: Months after Kansas voters affirmed abortion rights, Republican lawmakers propose multiple new laws
description: Republican lawmakers in Kansas proposed multiple laws to limit abortions at the state legislature's annual session. A statewide vote affirmed abortion rights seven months ago.

title: College Park, Maryland mayor arrested for child pornography, police say
description: College Park Mayor Patrick Wojahn, 47, was arrested Thursday morning on 40 counts of possessing and 16 counts of distributing child exploitative material.

title: Prince Harry, Meghan Markle get support from Fergie, Duchess of York amid family feud and eviction
description: Having been subjected to scrutiny herself, Sarah Ferguson, the Duchess of York, doesn't believe she can judge Prince Harry or Meghan Markle amid their rift with the British royal family.

title: 'Woke' Defense Department DEI education official's books now in one third of Pentagon schools: Gov't watchdog
description: "Racial justice" children's books that were authored or contributed to by the diversity chief of the Pentagon's education wing, according to OpenTheBooks.com, are in one third of all Pentagon schools.

title: Sunny Hostin angrily denounces Bill Maher's criticism of wokeness: 'He should be ashamed'
description: ABC's Sunny Hostin blasted comedian Bill Maher on Thursday during "The View" over his criticism of wokeness and claimed he should be "ashamed."

title: Elderly man kills teen neighbor over noise complaints: German police
description: The Italian neighbor, identified as Guiseppe Del B., had reportedly complained many times about noise from his neighbors, which led to him shooting the teen.

title: African World Health Organization official urges for more support to countries facing cholera outbreaks
description: A WHO official claims cholera has the potential to explode as rainfall persists in Africa. The official is urging more support to countries that are suffering from outbreaks.

title: Phoenix condo fire kills a man, severely injures 4 children
description: A man has died after sustaining serious injuries from a condo fire in Phoenix, Arizona. Four other children were in critical condition and were rushed to local hospitals.

title: Pennsylvania baby found safe after being taken in stolen car; police still seeking suspect and vehicle
description: Police in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania, are searching for a suspect who stole a vehicle from a mother with her infant daughter still inside on Wednesday night.

title: Greek transportation minister resigns, station manager arrested after head-on train crash kills 57
description: A train station manager is facing charges in Greece and a transportation chief has resigned following a deadly head-on collision between a passenger and freight train.

title: 2 Native HI men to be sentenced for a hate crime after brutally beating a white man
description: A couple of Native Hawaiians will soon be sentenced for a federal hate crime. The men kicked, punched, and used a shovel to beat a white man trying to move to a traditional village.

title: South Dakota lawmakers advance bills aimed at regulating the state's relationships with foreign entities
description: South Dakota lawmakers passed a bill that requires agricultural landowners to report whether their businesses are owned by foreign entities. Lawmakers advanced multiple similar bills.

title: Here's when popular DC cherry blossoms are forecast to peak
description: The Washington, D.C., cherry blossoms are forecast to peak later this month. The trees were a gift from Japan in 1912, and more have been planted since then.

title: Cryptic Dodge video teases new muscle car, but what does it mean?
description: Dodge has released a new teaser video for the last V8-powered car it will ever build. The clip includes a clue as to what to expect from the performance model.

title: Netanyahu rips 'anarchists' who staged mass protest outside salon with wife inside
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu condemned protesters for harassing his wife as she went to a hair salon in Tel Aviv on Wednesday, leading to a police standoff.

title: Iowa State dismisses senior guard for failing to meet expectations: ‘I said something that I regret’
description: The Iowa State Cyclones dismissed senior guard Caleb Grill on Wednesday for failing to meet expectations. Grill posted to social media that he said something he regrets.

title: FBI threat tag created after Supreme Court's Dobbs ruling 'shifted' to focus on pro-lifers, whistleblower says
description: EXCLUSIVE: An FBI threat tag led agents to “focus” on pro-life individuals following the Supreme Court’s decision to overturn Roe v. Wade, a whistleblower said.

title: MSU shooting survivor reveals lockdown horror, woman screaming like bloody murder
description: Michigan State student Marcy Creevy, 19, recalled the night Anthony McRae opened fire on the East Lansing campus and killed three students before killing himself.

title: Eye drop scare, plus safety issues: What you must know
description: The Fox News Health Newsletter brings you trending and important stories about health warnings, drug shortages, mental health issues and more in this weekly recap.

title: Chinese nationals operate nearly every illegal indoor marijuana farm in the largest US county, sergeant says
description: The largest county in the country has dealt with many illegal marijuana operations in past years, but as enforcement ramps up, immigrants are on the front lines.

title: Michigan AG says FBI confirmed she was target of 'heavily armed' man plotting attack on Jewish politicians
description: Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel said FBI confirmed she was a target in a plot to murder Jewish elected officials after the indictment against Jack Eugene Carpenter was unsealed.

title: LSU’s Carla Tejedo putts for birdie as opponent walks her line, sparking etiquette debate
description: A viral moment at a college golf tournament has stirred a debate on social media about golf etiquette, after an opponent walked the line of LSU’s Carla Tejedo as she putt for birdie.

title: Antonio Brown returns to football as part owner of arena league franchise
description: Antonio Brown was named the part-owner of the National Arena League's Albany Empire -- a franchise where his father dominated the sport for several years.

title: Seattle school district forced to do layoffs amid plummeting student enrollments
description: Seattle Public Schools announced on Tuesday that the district is being forced to lay off employees amid financial turmoil caused by plummeting student enrollments.

title: CA bill proposal would require households to provide safe workplaces for nannies, cleaners
description: A bill aimed at protecting nannies and cleaners by requiring households to comply with safety standards has been proposed in the California Legislature.

title: Kenya's president criticizes Supreme Court ruling allowing activist to register an LGBTQ rights organization
description: A recent Supreme Court ruling allowed an activist to register an LGBTQ rights organization in Kenya. Kenya's president criticized the ruling.

title: Underground MT coal mine with a history of safety violations collapses, injuring 3
description: An underground coal mine collapsed in southern Montana and injured three workers. Although the area caved in for unknown reasons, the mine has had a history of safety violations.

title: Former WA sergeant sentenced for strangling mother for 2 hours, threatening her with machete
description: A former Washington sergeant was sentenced for domestic violence. The man returned to his home drunk, choked a woman for over two hours, and threatened to kill her with a machete.

title: European Union officials set up scheme to speed up delivery of howitzer artillery rounds to Ukraine
description: EU officials are looking for a way to speed up the delivery of howitzer artillery rounds to Ukraine. They are also discussing dedicating an extra billion euros to help the country.

title: Dogs get chipped. Why are some people doing the same?
description: Many people chip pets to find them when they get lost, but now chips are being made for people. Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson explains whether we can be chipped safely.

title: Viral video shows English bulldog refusing to give up knife
description: Fendi, an English bulldog living in Los Angeles, has taken the internet by storm due to video of her running around a house with a kitchen knife in her mouth.

description: An Apple iPhone charging feature is reportedly facing new scrutiny. The feature aims to reduce a user's carbon footprint and is automatically turned on with iOS 16 software.

description: After "Jeopardy!" host Mayim Bialik asked a game show contestant what their quirky hobby is, Audrey revealed she is an "old soul" and collects "obsolete" items.

description: Rebecca Kiessling, the mother who lost her two sons to fentanyl poisoning, slammed President Biden for laughing while speaking of her sons tragic death.

description: Kevin Durant made his debut for the Phoenix Suns Wednesday night against the Charlotte Hornets, scoring 23 points on 10-15 shooting from the field.

title: Chicago police officer killed while chasing armed teen suspect identified
description: The Chicago police officer shot and killed during a shootout with a suspect Wednesday has been identified as officers with the department continue to mourn.

description: In an effort to reduce the Wisconsin government's footprint in Madison, Gov. Evers wants to sell three state office buildings. The moves are a "win-win for taxpayers and state workers."

description: Pakistan has freed retired Gen. Shoaib, a critic of the current prime minister, who was arrested for inciting the public against national institutions.

title: Dead humpback whale found floating off New Jersey coast
description: Another Humpback whale was seen floating approximately 4,500 feet of the coast of New Jersey on Wednesday, March 1.

title: NYPD ditches timed 1.5-mile run despite 'dead-set' pushback from police commissioner
description: The NYPD dropped a 1.5-mile timed run that new recruits must complete in 14 minutes and 21 seconds as the department struggles with staffing shortages.

title: Hundreds of dead fish wash ashore Florida beaches
description: Beaches across parts of southwest Florida are dealing with hundreds of dead fish and eels which were washed ashore amid reports of a red tide.

title: NYT flamed for student op-ed arguing progressive universities 'alienate' conservatives: 'Science fiction'
description: Various members of the media attacked a New York Times guest essay that claimed progressive campus attitudes are pushing Ivy League students to the right.

title: Dad slapped with fine after family stays too long at McDonald’s Playland parking lot: reports
description: A British man is fighting a fine he received in the mail after his wife and kids went to a McDonald's restaurant and exceeded the parking lot time limit by 10 minutes.

title: President Biden, first lady's restaurant order sparks strong reactions
description: President Biden and his wife Jill reportedly ordered the same rigatoni dish at Washington, D.C. restaurant Red Hen last month, fueling Internet debates about whether or not that was unusual.

title: Deion Sanders at the center of religion controversy months before Colorado starts 2023 season
description: Deion Sanders has been put at the center of controversy surrounding his decision to pray with his team even before he's taken the field and coached the players.

title: Padres All-Star pitcher sidelined with broken toe after weightlifting accident
description: San Diego Padres All-Star pitcher Joe Musgrove suffered a broken toe this week after dropping a kettlebell on his foot during a weightlifting accident, manager Bob Melvin said.

title: Brian Flores’ discrimination case against NFL can move to court, judge rules
description: A judged ruled that ex-Dolphins head coach Brian Flores' claims against the NFL did not qualify for private arbitration and allowed the case to proceed to court.

title: Lori Lightfoot torpedoed after losing re-election bid: 'Good riddance!'
description: 'The Five' co-hosts react to Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot's reelection loss and what message voters are sending to officials as crime rates continue to spike.

title: Wisconsin landowners sue to remove Native tribe's roadblocks in road dispute
description: Wisconsin property owners have filed a lawsuit requesting a court to order the removal of roadblocks set up by a Native American tribe in a years-long land dispute.

title: Michael B. Jordan apologized to his mom before steamy Calvin Klein underwear ad was released
description: Michael B. Jordan was honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame on Wednesday. The "Creed III" director and star spoke to Fox News Digital about the monumental moment.

title: White House says solution to TikTok in the works, would not say whether service would be banned
description: The White House addressed concerns about TikTok and spoke about a bipartisan plan to act against the social media platform, though they would not say if the app would be banned.

title: Tennessee lawmakers look to legally define 'sex,' restrict ID name changes
description: Tennessee lawmakers advanced a bill that would prevent transgender individuals from changing their sex on their driver's licenses and birth certificates.

title: Kristin Cavallari jokes she’s 'heartless' for breaking up with guys over text: 'I know that’s horrible'
description: Kristin Cavallari called herself "heartless" this week, admitting she's ended relationships via text in the past. The Uncommon James mogul was previously married to Jay Cutler.

title: Unveiling budget plan, Massachusetts Gov. Healey calls for millionaire's tax
description: Democratic Massachusetts Gov. Maura Healey proposed a $55.5 billion state budget Wednesday, with a millionaire's tax being a key agenda item in the package.

title: Former Ohio House Speaker denies dinners with energy execs during corruption trial
description: Former Republican Ohio House Speaker Larry Householder, contradicting FBI testimony, denied hosting dinners with executives where a bribery scheme was allegedly conceived.

title: Los Angeles police union proposes officers stop responding to non-violent, non-emergency calls
description: The Los Angeles Police Department's rank-and-file union issued a set of proposals Wednesday for officers to only respond to violent calls.

title: Orlando-bound Spirit Airlines flight from Dallas diverted to Jacksonville after battery catches fire: FAA
description: A Spirit Airlines flight going to Orlando, Florida, diverted to Jacksonville on Wednesday after a battery fire was reported by crew on the plane.

title: Georgia middle school teacher arrested for allegedly molesting student in library closet
description: A Macon, Georgia middle school special education teacher was arrested this week for allegedly going into a school storage room and molesting a student.

title: Senators land Jakob Chychrun as Coyotes continue to unload talent before trade deadline
description: The Ottawa Senators are officially making a playoff push, acquiring Arizona Coyotes standout defenseman Jakob Chychrun for three draft picks Wednesday.

title: New Jersey police help get baby seal back to safety after it took 'wrong turn'
description: A grey seal pup was found near a highway by Brick Township police officers in New Jersey, who helped her cross safely before she was reintroduced to the wild.

title: Scottie Pippen’s ex-wife says she has Michael Jordan's blessing to date son
description: The ex-wife of Scottie Pippen, Larsa, opened up about her new relationship with Michael Jordan's son, Marcus, on Tuesday and confirmed that the Bulls star has given them his blessing.

title: Pence won't say he'll back Trump in 2024 if former president wins GOP nomination
description: During an interview with CBS News, former Vice President Mike Pence did not say whether he would support former President Trump if he won the GOP nomination in 2024.

title: Michigan Senate votes to enshrine LGBTQ protections into state's civil rights law
description: The Michigan state Senate voted Wednesday in favor of a proposal to expand the state's civil rights law to include the LGBTQ community under anti-discrimination policies.

title: California high school student stabbed to death in art class: police
description: A California teenager was stabbed to death at school during a fight with another student, police said.

title: New research shows where early humans survived in Ice Age-era Europe
description: New research reveals that early humans who took refuge in modern-day Spain and Portugal were the only Europeans to survive the last Ice Age.

title: Oklahoma City manhunt underway after Hobby Lobby employee shoots and kills manager at distribution center
description: A Hobby Lobby employee is on the run after shooting and killing a manager at a distribution center on Wednesday afternoon in Oklahoma City, according to police.

title: House subcommittee sets date for first hearing on COVID origins following FBI's lab leak admission
description: The House COVID Subcommittee announced that it will hold its first hearing on the origins of the coronavirus next week, which comes after the FBI's admission that it likely came from a lab.

title: North Carolina, Denmark agency sign wind energy agreement
description: The governments of North Carolina and Denmark have formally agreed to work together to aid the U.S. in building wind energy operations off the Atlantic coast.

title: 65 year old Alabama man killed after being attacked by dogs
description: A 65-year-old Alabama man was killed Tuesday monring after being attacked by dogs. Six dogs were trapped and taken to Animal Control facilities where they were euthanized.

title: Kentucky Senate approves bill to expand address confidentiality
description: The Kentucky Senate has approved a bill that will expand address confidentiality. The purpose of the bill is to protect domestic violence victims from their abusers.

title: Florida man sentenced to 6 years for $4.2M COVID relief fraud scheme
description: A Florida man was sentenced to six years for trying to obtain more than $4.2M in a COVID relief fraud scheme. In addition to his prison time, the man must also repay more than $2.1 million.

title: Buffalo, NY, reeling over firefighter killed in building inferno
description: Local leaders in Buffalo, New York, solemnly addressed the Wednesday death of one of the city's firefighters, who was killed inside a burning commercial building.

title: WWE star Sonya Deville faces gun possession charge in New Jersey
description: Daria Berenato, the WWE star known as Sonya Deville, was arrested last month at New Jersey casino on an unlawful possession of a weapon charge.

title: New York City could pay Black Lives Matter protesters $21K each over rights 'violations' in 2020
description: New York City could pay Black Lives Matter protesters arrested in 2020 thousands of dollars each as part of a proposed settlement in a class-action lawsuit.

title: PGA Tour makes schedule changes in response to LIV Golf's rise, including more designated events with no cuts
description: The PGA Tour continues make changes in response to competitive threats LIV Golf poses. This time, the PGA has eliminated cuts from eight "designated" events.

title: New live-action 'Peter Pan' trailer shocks with major character changes: 'Diversity nonsense'
description: The latest live-action “Peter Pan” remake from Disney faced backlash from its first trailer on Tuesday after turning half of the “Lost Boys” into girls.
